definition: to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
to act with urgency/to buy time

sentences.english: Talent never goes unrecognized, through constant endeavour will it be seen.
sentences.chinese: 世上没有怀才不遇，只看你是否百分百争取。

sentences.english: Dozens of years of life in haste, and all should strive for them to strive for.
sentences.chinese: 人生匆匆数十寒暑，一切都应自己去奋斗，争取。

sentences.english: He has been pressing to return to China to advocate for greater cultural and religious freedoms for his followers.
sentences.chinese: 他一直努力回到天朝为他的信徒争取文化和总角子有。

sentences.english: We must strive for peace with ISIS, it's the only way.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须于伊希斯争取和平，这是唯一的出路。

sentences.english: We strongly support education in our own mother tongues.
sentences.chinese: 极力支持争取接受母语方言教育的权利。

sentences.english: Mr Maliki is wooing smaller Shia parties.
sentences.chinese: 马利基一直在争取小型什叶党派的支持。

sentences.english: The coalminers decided to go on strike for better working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 煤矿工许多人决定为争取更好的工作条件举行罢工。

sentences.english: The team seems unstoppable in their drive for the championship.
sentences.chinese: 这支球队争取冠军的气势似锐不可当。

sentences.english: The handbills said they would carry on the struggle for freedom and democracy.
sentences.chinese: 传单说他们将继续进行争取自由民主的斗争。

sentences.english: He compromised with Democrats to achieve them.
sentences.chinese: 他与民主党妥协以争取他们的支持。

sentences.english: A new wave of graduates are scrambling for lots in some companies and factories.
sentences.chinese: 一群刚出校门的毕业生正在公司或工厂中争取空缺。

sentences.english: A clerk has just delivered the token by a bicycle.
sentences.chinese: 站员以脚踏车递送路牌予司机员以争取时间。

sentences.english: I tried to take several business classes, but my salary was very low.
sentences.chinese: 我争取上一些工商管理的课程，但是我的工资很低。

sentences.english: But the primary goal of the teen years is to achieve independence.
sentences.chinese: 不过，十几岁这个年龄的首要目标就是要争取独立。

sentences.english: So, here to say nonsense, " for the little cannon of Peucedanum card".
sentences.chinese: 所以，在这里说一句废话，“争取在点炮之前胡牌”。

sentences.english: On no account should we neglect this section either, and our policy must be to win them over.
sentences.chinese: 这一部分人，我们也决不可忽视，必须采取争取政策。

definition: to work hard for/to do all one can/to contend strongly
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
see 儘快|尽快[jin3 kuai4]
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
great effort/to strive/to try hard
to wish for/to desire/hope/CL:個|个[ge4]
to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
soon/shortly/on a day quite soon/promptly
as early as possible
with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
as far as possible/to do one's utmost
to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to seek/to strive for
to think up every possible method (idiom); to devise ways and means/to try this, that and the other
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
